nwdtUJZb8dC2OTl7HKBeqA.text: A group of us were treated to a morning at Chipotle's second restaurant in London, which has been open for a couple of months now, in order to get a better understanding of this American burrito chain.The proposition is Food with Integrity as indicated by the chicken listed as Higher Welfare on the menu! Our experience of being tutored in how to make the in-house guacamole certainly showed that Chipotle have a passion for ingredients and food preparation. They represent the better aspects of the American attitude towards food.My pork (outdoor reared) burrito was tasty and filling  qualifying as a full meal as far as I'm concerned, although I did include a dollop of guacamole at an extra cost of £1.40 in addition to the burrito cost of £6.95. Generally burritos are in the £6.50  £6.95 price range.Given that there are now about 1,200 Chipotle restaurants in the US, which has a population about five times the size of the UK, that implies about 250 outlets could be opening up in the UK over the coming years if the popularity of the burrito takes off over here  and in my opinion that would be no bad thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom

Z9xAP9a54ll3v4ZZ1UFzkw.text: Omg!had the best breakfast buritto ever.I mashed up the place!well just 48 hass advocados,add cilantro,red onion,salt,lime,lemon special spicy concotions,hey presto u have the most fresh fragant guacomole!delicious.Jacob is v passionate and informed about the history, background passport credentials of ALL the ingredients used at Chipotle.You can taste the levels of flavour be it tomatoes or jalepenos peppers each and every item that goes into the flavour experience is distinct.All I can say is go and check it out fast and furious but do not underestimate it.

z7qArGB-dEcVHSqInfKGUg.text: FOOD WITH INTEGRITY!Couldnt have said it better myself. Was lucky enough to attend the event on Saturday morning. Massive thanks to Jacob and his staff for a very interesting morning. I think one would need to go far to find people with such passion for what they do  fast food WITH integrity  yes! Prepared freshly every day, tasty, wholesome and filling  well worth a visit.More details of the store here blazingmonkey.com/1/post…- CHIPOTLE-for-Burritos-Baker-Street-London-.html

2B6NE2XdSKPhSLjNa7s1xQ.text: Thanks to Qype for a fantastic event! I've been a longtime customer of Chipotle, so it was an absolute pleasure to hear more about their brand ethos and the care and attention they put into their products.And what food they make! I had to surrender my afternoon, accepting my fate to lie as a beached whale upon my couch.I'll write a longer review on my blog in the next few days, and I'll post the link here!

HsuPQA7wdfOQEQ1udfWRLw.text: Simple menu, fresh ingredients and quick service. I visit here for a quick option when I'm hungry. Always busy but short wait. The black beans and pork is the most tasty combo and I usually have a burrito.

5FXGQpi7t__WsYf2ugxtXg.text: Well I didn't think I would see Chipotle in the middle of London! So I was very curious to see how they differ from the US if at all. Well I got a burrito bowl which was pretty much the same as in the US. They were skimping on the rice and chicken. I don't know maybe I'm being a fat American but I guess I'm use to my Burrito Bowl being the size of a newborn baby... But seriously apart from that they did have very juicy chicken and steak. I took away a star for the cheapness while serving and another because they had a dirty lobby for not being very busy, plus they had at least 7 people working. I don't know if its a thing people in the UK are use to, but nobody would throw their trash away they would always leave their trays and cups on the table and just leave. This was a cute little surprise but I love Chipotle in the US!

pcYQ3L68ZSemmvHyEBY4Rw.text: After living in Europe for 8 months, I was so happy to walk by this Chipotle.  It was very consistent with the US locations in terms of menu and quality of food.  The customer service was excellent, all of the items looked very fresh and overall as expected.  Definitely will be back...

oq6ONNBsEj1esW4Klwwi_A.text: I love Chipotle when I'm in New York I eat there every day and am never sick of it.  This London version of Chipotle is not Chipotle.  It tastes terrible.  I don't know what it is, it may be the Tortillas or just the people they hire but it is completelly different and completely dissapointing.  I hope they fix it and change whoever is running their European operation or close it all together.

JijeIzJtXyWJ8K0hZg_9hw.text: We were lucky enough to be invited to a great Qype event one Saturday morning which featured a guacamole-making workshop, and though at the root of it the process involves smashing up avocados, learning about how they do it at Chipotle was a perfect example of the care & attention that goes into their food. Store manager Jacob explained to us about the finely honed process surrounding their ingredients selection & constant quality control, and the sentence that still resounds in my mind from the morning was when he said: People think of burritos as fast food  what they don't see is the 12 hours of slow-food preparation we do behind the scenes so that they can get it in 5 minutes. The burritos at the Marylebone store are every bit as flavoursome, spicy, and fulfilling as the Charing Cross Road branch, which is handy to know because it's critical to be able to get a decent burrito no matter where you are in this amazing city.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom

rb1-tbq7aq8FtU5QdA-r9w.text: Tucked away on a corner of Baker Street usually inhabited by (infested with?) large packs of spotty teenage tourists with matching yellow rucksacks of a Saturday morning, or suited office types of a weekday lunchtime, lies London's newest addition to the fast-growing world of quality fast food.As one who has always believed the phrase quality fast food to be completely incongruous in itself, and therefore who usually shuns fast food (fast), Chipotle is, admittedly, a place that on any other day I might pass-by without giving it a thought. It's unique to this country; sadly the idea of quality fast food has passed us poor Brits by, yet every time I visit the US  a deli in NYC or a burger joint in Portland, I am bowled-over by how decent the food is. On the other hand, your average UK sandwich shop or independent burger shop (Chicken Cottage, anyone? Subway? EW!) fill me with The Fear.Enter: Chipotle.By quality fast food, I mean that the ingredients are sourced by the restaurant directly, all food is created from scratch onsite and on the same day  even the tortilla chips  and more importantly, a great deal of care and love is pumped into all aspects of food creation.Chipotle is an American-Mexican restaurant which I dearly hope will play a small part in changing the game with UK fast food. Even I can bring myself to use the R word (rather than calling it a joint or mere outlet), especially when I know my quick-grab lunch is the product of about 6 hours of preparation by real cooks.It has a rather beautiful and quirky history; a chain with a soul, if you will. Despite its brief foray into some form of partnership with the proprietors of the Big Golden Arches (eeeevil), Chipotle has stayed true to its roots and sources its ingredients locally, where possible. Essentially that means: meats and vegetables from the UK. Of course there are exceptions: avocados are seasonal and they are mostly imported from far-off warm lands.To give you a quick idea of the level of care and knowledge that goes into the food here, our guide Jacob talked about the difference in flavour of avocados from various different countries and at different times of the year. We were moving into the time of the year where the Hass avocados are sourced from Chilli, which meant they wouldn't be perfect for another few weeks. Or what about the difference in flavour profile of guacamole depending on what kind of salt is used? Enough said, right? They know their stuff!The proof was in the pudding, though. The pork burrito with black bean and mild chilli and guac was absolutely superb.I'm all about a good burrito, it used to be difficult picking one up anywhere in London  especially to go  but it's getting easier these days.Don't be fooled: although Chipotle serves your lunch in 3 minutes flat, this is some seriously brilliant food.

CThv17PatIPOBf41TmJ6YA.text: Fantastic! Really enjoyed the talk and learning about the real ingredients and care that goes into all the food!

StINxB_uyvUG1ypzG1Md8Q.text: Went to the event yesterday and I must say, It was just great. This is the best take-away Mexican food I have ever sampled. It's original, handmade, and simply taste like it should with all freshly prepared ingredients.I shall definitely recommend this restaurant to all my good friends.

jUevs10PVIDPUpAlE6fggQ.text: What an amazing way start your weekend !!! Having spoken to one of the faces of the chain and having seen how much effort goes into preparing a meal that you only spend a minute ordering I have to say I would recommend this place to everybody who can really appreciate high quality food made with passion.I also noticed during today's presentation how nuts they are about hygiene and this is a definite plus !!!

J4fEDBVv_AOrgj27QoNlcQ.text: For a quick bite, this can be a tasty and healthy option.First, a caveat.  I grew up in northern California decades ago and was weaned on this kind of food -- fresh, Americanized Mexican food.  I've since learned about authentic Mexican food (along with the rest of California) and I love that.  But I still have a place in my heart (stomach?) for fresh Cal-Mex cuisine like this.  (By the way, I've been in London so long that I have not been to a Chipotle in the US, so I won't be able to compare.)I went here for lunch and had a barbacoa (shredded) beef burrito.  The tortilla is nicely thin, tasty, and chewy. Not like the cold floury El Paso or Discovery ones.  They warm it right before they build your burrito.  You get a choice of white or brown (light brown, not dark) rice (or probably none).  I opted for the brown rice because I like that nutty flavor.  The rice has cilantro in it and is quite tasty on its own. You also have a choice of pinto or black beans.  I got the pinto (with pork fat).  Hot, medium, or mild salsa (I got hot, which has a respectable kick). Lettuce (romaine), sour cream, cheese, and guacamole.  There were also steak (cubed), chicken, pork carnitas and grilled veggies choices.  You can also get the stuff on a salad or a taco (not sure what kind of taco shell since I didn't see anyone with it).  They also offer side orders of tortilla chips (crisps), which I did not get but could tell by the looks of them that they are decent and not the annoyingly hard ones in most Mexican restaurants.This is very much your fill'er-up burrito that I used to get in California as a university student - the kind that gets you full on $3.  Now it's £6.70, but you get the idea.  It's definitely fresh and quite tasty, and it certainly filled me up.  That's plenty of rather filling food (quite a bit more than a shawarma sandwich, I think).  I liked it very much, although I think next time, I would ask them to put in less rice and beans.  The only issue I have was that the wrap itself was so big that there's quite a bit of tortilla in the meal.The staff were friendly and quick (the long line at 12.45pm went very quickly).  The place was clean and kept clean.  Looking forward to going back soon.

UcmSv6u8l3JFUHj059G0FA.text: Yum Yum Yum Chipotle. Whilst probably not the best burrito I've ever eaten, Chipotle definitely is in joint first place with Tortilla and on the way to being the best chain burrito place in London (I know they have a bizzillion places in the U.S already though)A pretty decent selection of meats, heavy (in a good way) on the farm assured ethical rearing of the animals, I chose to eat the carnitas (pork) with Guac while also getting a sideorder or tortilla chips. The burritos on offer here are definitely on the 'super size' scale of burritos - you're going to get a full lunch and possible meat sweats is all I'll say, while the guacamole tastes fresh and creamy (although £1.20 extra for it does seem a little excessive). The only downside which I see time and time again in UK burrito joints is the absolute lack of knowledge and ability in rolling it. This time it looked more like the lady was parceling something up to send back home and it would only be a matter of minutes before she's sitting on it and strapping it with parcel tape to get it shut!! Put it this way, one end had Guac in it, one had sour cream - not the mix throughout that I'd have obviously preferred! Saying that, the tortilla chips are cooked fresh in front of you and have a taste that can't be beat so make sure you get an extra side of this to go with your burrito.

Mj7YE8dsFC4JfpaUIdu-Jw.text: GROT - -Only 2/3 the size of a USA Chipotle burrito-Rip-off prices e.g. Chicken Burrito costs £6.70 in UK but US price works out to be £3.79... that's 77% more folks!-You have to pay extra for guacamoleHOT - *Quality ingredients*Freshly made to your specification*Not many other places to get US style Mexican in London*Fresh, crisp taco shells and chips

GJ6ZGwDynjHUHpPaQs0rHg.text: I love me some Chipotle. I've been in Europe for about three months and this is just about the time you start craving anything and everything that tastes like home. Now, let me address the haters because I'm feeling particularly passionate about my love for Chipotle right now. Or maybe I'm just homesick. A lot of the arguments that are made in bad reviews just suck.#1 - It's more expensive than in the US. Well, DUH! Everything in London is more expensive than in the US. Haven't you heard the rule of thumb: everything in London is the same price as in the US, it's just denominated in pounds?#2 - It's not as big of a portion as in the US. First of all, my burrito tonight was huge and I'm pretty sure it's just as big as at home. Second, even if it were smaller, humans should not consume that much burrito in one sitting anyway so everyone would be better off if they were smaller. P.S. If Americans are complaining about the size of this already gigantic meal, we are only giving more evidence to why America is so obese.#3 - You have to pay extra for guac. You have to pay extra for guac back home too, this is nothing new. Circle back to #1 about the rule of thumb pricing and all order is restored.Clearly, I love Chipotle. This trip was no different. My only complaint is that the rice wasn't cooked very well (a little hard) but I still thoroughly enjoyed my meal. Thanks for your great restaurant, Denver!

qt9BzBVGsiGmuQryoqAnIQ.text: I am so excited that Chipotle has come to the UK. I went a few times when I was in the states over the course of last year and I literally love it. The UK version doesn't disappoint. What I like best is that you can get a "bowl" instead of a burrito, that's essentially all the rice, lettuce, meat, sour cream, salsa and cheese fully loaded into a bowl, sans the tortilla or wrap. It's frigging delicious. I took my old colleague on Wednesday and she agreed. I think my bowl was around about 550 cals (I looked it up online, what a loser) so actually not too bad for something which is fully fat loaded with cheese and sour cream. #greedy-people-of-the-world-on-a-diet-unite-and-rejoice :)

yRBpy1rT-19qaUXo61aL-w.text: At this place they make the best guacamole I've had in London. It's fast, it's fresh, it's cheap. Perfect quick lunch, hangover food, juicy food.Plus you don't have to be afraid to eat in, because it's fairly clean and smells fairly fresh!It's big 'YAAAYY!!' from me!

smXc6v7QN2FMPQa-jI2org.text: Chipotle is a great burrito, but it is more expensive than other comparable restaurants. Being North American, it was the very first place I scoped out when I moved to London and frequented it a lot at the beginning. The prices don't seem that much higher than other places but asking about £1.50 for guacamole is nearly double other burrito joints in London. It's a great eat, huge portion and loaded with everything makes the perfect meal. The price compared to North American prices is more, and compared to other restaurants in London tends to be more. Honestly, I prefer other burritos over Chipotle burritos but don't get me wrong: I am a big fan of Chipotle. I only gave three stars based on price and because their guacamole isn't the best in London for approx. £1.50 extra. That's outrageous for the little scoop you get. The choice of rice also puts me off a little bit, white cilantro rice or brown cilantro rice- boring. Overall, Chipotle is a great eat but not the best in London. I prefer Tortilla Mexican Grill- cheaper, better guac and Mexican rice as an option. I think their burritos are tastier than Chipotle, personally.

LUM87rM1Uo2ym9gfrZfp1g.text: Chee-Pote-Leh is probably the closest phonetic pronunciation. Please don't pronounce it with a "lay" sound instead of "leh". Trust me on this. I almost avoided coming here because of all the negative reviews saying the taste would be disappointing, and I'm sooooo glad I didn't listen to all of the negative reviews below. Note:  The UK in general is very lacking in delicious authentic Mexican food, and thankfully they make up for it with the amazing Indian food I've tasted here. (Of course, the reason is because there aren't many Mexican immigrants coming to the UK and setting up shop.) Having said that, Chipotle is an Americanised Mexican chain, so while it might not be the same food you'll encounter in the eateries and street stalls of Mexico, it does a superlative job of providing fresh Mexican ingredients and food. As a native from Los Angeles (meaning LOADS of Mexican food growing up) living in England for the past 6 months, I've sorely missed Chipotle and I can definitely say eating here hit the spot! I am so particular with flavours, and while I admit the mild salsa is slightly different and the burrito didn't taste *exactly* the same, it still is probably the best burrito in the UK and you can still totally tell it is a Chipotle burrito. Burritos start at £6.70~ for chicken and up to £6.95~ for carnitas (shredded pork, crispy edges, soft meat- one of my favourite meats!), barbacoa (spicy shredded beef), and I forget the last one but I think it was just grilled beef. I believe the extra charge for guacamole is £1.40 which I always bite the bullet for because me + guacamole are like two peas in a pod. 4 stars instead of 5 for the inflated London prices (change the £ to $ and you're not far off) and for *not quite* tasting as good as back home, but still would come back and eat here in a heartbeat.

nZ7IWbHugkk98uxX20MkZw.text: I was there to film the Qype event and it was a great experience from the start onwards. Jacob talked everybody through the history of Chipotle, to have a better understanding of the Burrito chain. They have got over 1200 shops in the US so that says a lot about the brand. All the Qypers did seem to enjoy all the preparations, it was endearing to see all geared up on a lovely saturday morning. Thanks to all, I got some really nice things on camera watch this space. Definitely recommend, the burrito was massive!

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom

wqSH41vafRsw1elxFYUdMg.text: I was so excited when I saw that Chipotle was in London. Lot of room to sit inQuality fresh ingredientsBig portionsBUT if you have been to Chipotle in the US you will notice that it is such a rip-off! And to top it all guacamole - the best ingredient - is extra. UghIn a nutshell: I only go when I am in the US

v7HL3JLc-FWnFea08qS49g.text: As an American living in Britain, a Chipotle opening up around the corner was a welcome addition to my neighborhood.  Though my Mexican-food-cravings have dwindled due to the disappointing showing of most places claiming to serve it here, I popped in one day and it all came rushing back.First off, the staff in this place MUST all be saints, as I felt like I was at Starbucks with the diva-like orders that I was witnessing. "I'd like some chicken, but not too much chicken, and no beans, cheese, sour cream or any of the other things.  Oh but I'd like some lettuce...a little bit more...[as she's paying] - can you actually add a bit more lettuce?"  I think by the end, a few of the people who were ahead of me in line literally walked out with wrapped up lettuce.  The ingredients looked decent, though I'm fairly sure I got the dregs of the carnitas - shocking, since this was just prior to the lunch rush - I probably got yesterday's leftovers!  Anyways, the equivalent of about $15 later, I felt somewhat satisfied walking out with the weight of a small child in my shopping bag, stomach grumbling all the way home.  The rest is a bit of a blur, but all-in-all I am sad to say it was just OK.  The chips were stale (seriously?) and my burrito bowl lacked something, not able to put my finger on it - probably some kind of trans-fat/MSG/crack combo they manage to sneak in there at home.For Americans - this is not the Chipotle of the Americas.  If you're having a craving and there's nothing else, check it out for marginally good Mexican.  You'll be a welcome face in line as you say "I'd like everything please"For Brits - I know this type of food is not your strong suit, but if you do end up here,  try going all in.  You ruin the burrito experience by picking and choosing.  It's sort of a "the whole is greater than the sum of its parts" kind of experiment...or something like that...

lmoILNNajYlYu3gUeOmTpw.text: I love love love tacos! And I became a big fan of Chipotle when I spent a summer in California last summer. But I don't think this Chipotle in London was near as good as the ones in California, and the waitress barely knew what a tortilla was since most English people only order the burrito. But overall, stoked to find a Chipotle and taco spot in London :)

FDZa6s7h7WOpzytGkor6LA.text: What is this?!  How could Chipotle turn into something so horrible?  I didn't expect the London Chipotle to be an exact replica of the Chipotles in the US.  I figured they'd have to use a few different products, features, etc.   I DID expect the London Chipotle to be equal to the US Chipotles in terms of quality, service, and consistency.  The food was terrible.  They offered brown rice and colorful peppers, which I liked.  However, all of the food looked like it had been sitting out for ages.  They were out of brown rice by the time I got to the front of the line and the staffer kept complaining about how nobody was making any more.  The guacamole had HUGE chunks of something brown in it.  The tortilla in my burrito was soggy and gummy - super gross.  Plus, none of the staffers were wearing gloves (or washing their hands after coming back to the line after doing work cleaning tables).  And the portions were super tiny (1/2 scoop of rice in a veggie burrito that costs nearly $12!  And only a handful of chips in a bag!).  The burritos are SERIOUSLY overpriced.  They cost MORE in pounds than what I paid in dollars back home.  That is ridiculous given the exchange rate.  I wouldn't even mind the steep price tag if the food was better and the portions normal.The service was bad.  They staffers weren't friendly.  They were slow.  The restaurant was dirty and food was all over the tables.  They insisted on charging me for guacamole even though it is included in the veggie burrito.  The funny part was that there were Americans in front of and behind me in line.  The guy in front of me was griping about the tiny portions and the guy behind me was upset about the super high prices.  People KNOW Chipotle for their fast, cheap, filling food.  You can't change up the formula this much and expect people not to notice/care.  Consistency is what makes Chipotle great, reliable, and a place to which I liked to return.  It's the same everywhere you go - from Brooklyn to Beaverton.  You know what you'll get and can be assured that your favorite combination will be the same from place to place.  That's what makes fast casual food so appealing.  The flight time from NY to Seattle is nearly the same as the flight time from NY to London.  I just don't understand why they can't get some of their staffers on a plane to London to do some training.   The US is a HUGE country (my home state is larger than Germany) and Chipotle manages to maintain consistency despite geographical distances and cultural differences in the US.  I wish they could figure out a way to do that in London too.

e1STJhC2Ip7hnrH9BcgVZA.text: The only thing I can say is wow, now this possibly can be my favorite place to eat. The burrito bowl is just amazing !!!!

1Wv4pw-CboJzJeWlqSwIsQ.text: Went to check out this new Chipotle that opened this week and was so happy! I actually like the UK version better than the US as it's a little healthier with the same flavors. Differences are there is a brown rice option in addition to the regular white rice with cilantro and the tortilla is a whole wheat blend. Another difference (probably due to cost) is carne asada is replaced with shredded beef. For those that have not been to a Chipotle, it's a great place for a quick bite. There is a bunch of fresh fillings to pick from and you basically tell them what you want to put into your burrito or taco and it's ready to eat and enjoy. Yum!!Side note: I have to admit I would not have given a Chipotle a 5-star rating in the US as there are so many other choices for mexican food there, but since moving to London it's been hard to find good mexican food like in California. I'm really pleased how they were able to deliver the same flavors in London.

duiuC65Sk-O_3qCJ7Pb4PA.text: Yes sir! Quality products to get a tasty and fast meal. I had the veggie burrito with guacamole, truly amazing.

BhskYdP6THSktYwFXC3LQw.text: Do you know how long I've been craving Chipotle? Three years.Do you know when I boarded a plane to England from Chicago? Three years and two months ago.I am so angry that you guys didn't tell me about the two London locations sooner. (Though maybe not totally angry because when Chipotle first opened in Chicago I gained about ten pounds in a month so maybe you were keeping that info from me for my own good.) Speaking of gaining a lot of weight and eating fat and stuff, what's with the tiny portion of tortilla chips, Baker Street Chipotle? Do I look like some kind of ballerina to you? Do I look like a tiny dancer? Do I look like someone who would stop eating when I was full? No.

1vz_YfoF2E_uh7OWKqzfNA.text: I keep searching for good Mexican food in this town and I keep getting disappointed. When I heard that Chipotle was coming to my neighbourhood I was very excited. Chipotle burritos at home are huge, tasty and relatively inexpensive. They have lost some of their charm emigrating from across the pond.. The food did taste good but the portions are so small that it was just a tease. Here is a clue Chipotle, be a little more generous with your portions. The only authentically Mexican ting about this place was the bandito behind the cash register. I paid almost £25 for two burritos and three tacos. I am happy to pay more for good food but these guys have got to up their game.

3OG7Qgf2mZj7yMAaiO5gfw.text: Just like home. Thank God because I was beginning to think I wouldn't find palatable Mexican out here.

MUz5_c1dfxMQAF2gO4nfRA.text: Tastes nothing like the Chipotle in NY.  Brown rice?  Peppers?  Nothing tasted fresh at all.  It just tasted cheap and gross, the exact opposite of how it tastes in the States.  They need to synch up the ingredients because it's like a totally different restaurant in London.  I should've known it was going to be different when I asked for fajitas and they had no clue what I was talking about!Also, it's funny how all the Brits are giving the London Chipotle 4 or 5 stars and most of the Americans are giving it 1 or 2 stars - you guys are getting gypped!

FuvnAhu68B27fYq00NkzYg.text: Since my review when it was first opened, the service improved 100%. The food quality is also now better than the US. Still a bit overpriced but its worth it.

BFO4mzMusRcIVGrRgPshFw.text: Ok I got abit greedy. I grinned and asked for everything in mine except guacamole. I cant handle spice but my goodness if only I had a pint of milk next to me because I was burning. I opted for the £6.80 chicken burrito and as I was presented with it, I can really see the foil wrapping, fit to burst. For that price, it was good value for money. Good thing they came with a plate because otherwise it could get messy, very messy! The fillings were plentiful, tasty and good quality. Location wise, this place was perfect. It was near Baker Street station and with plentiful staff on hand, my burrito was quickly created from scratch. It's fast food but healthy. I could see that it was a huge hit with nearby office workers.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom

7zhcZpd-AcJP7hbZfIXIEA.text: Food is same as any other chipotle but wow they really are stingy at this location. Really small portions compared to your standard chipotle

ZYgLLKO4s6Cm_WwpiXA2wA.text: I'd seen the ads for chipotle in plenty of tube stations & I love chipotle peppers, but in my mind I thought of them as just another fast food chain until Yelp organised an event here and I was stripped thoroughly of my misconceptions!All the meat is sourced from free range farms, every item on the menu is prepared fresh on location. No central kitchen, pre packaged, frozen stuff here.I had a bowl with the carnitas, brown rice, pinto beans, veggies, guacamole, sour cream and topped with cheese. I also supplemented this with the fine sauces from Tabasco - chipotle & green pepper.It was so yummy and felt extremely healthy too (not counting the cheese) The meat was soft & tender, vegetables were freshly cut, not wilted. Guacamole was all fresh. So yeah, if there's a chipotle in the vicinity, I'd definitely consider them for a quick lunch and if it's an early dinner it can even be paired with Mexican beer & maybe a margarita! #YelpEveryDamnDay

Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom. #carnitas basket #FoodieAndFotographer #yelptoberfeast #yelpeverydamnday

k9Tx8OcT1A0Y32ckXKDVcQ.text: This place serves the nicest burritos! They really care about what they do - making guac & salsa so fresh it tastes amazing, cooking the meat at each branch themselves. I tried a combo of chicken and barbacoa (YUM) with brown rice, black beans, cheese, guac, mild salsa and sour cream. It was sooo jam packed that I felt sick after eating it! Too much for me for a lunch so I would definitely go for a salad bowl in future. At £6 it was such good value for money and really delicious. Friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom

ejsi9V5yeW7Wnd1FWcQh8A.text: I had a BURRITO of barbacoa!! It was my first time to eat a wrap in London.I put brown rice,brown beans,sour cream and lettuce. wanted guacamole but the staff said"You can't or it's extra..."(I couldn't catch what she said. But there was still a queue behind me, so I didn't ask again.)It was too big to bite so I ended up opening it to eat. I wondered if I could finish all this but I did!!! It was yammy. I would want to try a bowl with guacamole next time!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom. BURRIT of assuured beef!!
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom. BURRIT of assuured beef!!

hV6ERKGQeCmJxnpm8abVSw.text: A friend of mine confided in me that she had never eaten a burrito in her life, so I had to drag her to Chipotle to change that!I walked her through the ordering process and we both ended up with beautifully wrapped chicken burritos. I ordered mine mild, she got hers spicy and we both mightily enjoyed them.All ingredients at Chipotle are fresh and delicious and you get to build your own burrito exactly how you want it. If you haven't had a burrito from one of their shops yet or just really crave one, Chipotle is the place to go!

z0mCBpMxv4OACvMMjrRlrg.text: For a "fast food" restaurant you get served really outstanding quality of food. All their meats are free range, everything is made from scratch...even the vinaigrette and everything is chopped and cut by hand. WOW!!!!Chipotle really focuses on delivering hight quality and afordable food.From burritos to salad bowls, everything is really supper fresh...they make their guacamole 3 times a day. They also serve absolutely fantastic margaritas.  Must vist for any fan of Mexican food.

Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom. Fresh tortilla chips
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom. Special Chipotle tabasco

IyT04qCTvYMb65AFxvc30A.text: 1. tortilla chips with guacamole - I know the guacamole is the star but I am quite drawn to the tortilla chips. They are quitesalty, the texture has just the right crunch. Dipped into the soft and smooth guacamole, it was a favourite.2. a choice of white/brown rice, followed by a choice of meat and I went for the steak, plentiful of salad, choice of pinto or black beans, sour cream, cheese, salsas, guacamole. It sounded like a lot to decide but not when it was your turn.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom. buritto
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom. tortilla chips
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom. margaritah

fu_-bsgLW20a1N2JDbVSdQ.text: This chipotle isn't my favourite one in London.  Every time I get something here, there's something that doesn't go quite right.The first time, the people working were incredibly stingy! So much to the point where the flavours of all the ingredients weren't balanced and it wasn't very good tasting.The second time, I got a bowl and the same thing happened again. A lacklustre bowl of not enough balanced flavours...just a crap load of meat and puny servings of rice, salsas, cheese and lettuce.The third time, I got a burrito.  And finally I felt like I got the usual and proportional toppings I had hoped for...but the burrito was poorly wrapped and for some odd reason VERY LEAKY!  I had this as a take-away, and it was so embarrassing as I had to eat my burrito on top of the brown paper bag it came with.  Liquid somehow oozed through the tortilla, through the foil and  was thankfully caught into a pool/divot I made with the paper bag.  Towards the final 3rd of the burrito, it completely fell apart and I looked like a moron at my desk.Really don't know what to say.  I have had a semi-consistent experience with my meals here, and all of them were not as great as other chipotle locations.  I come here hoping for a great tex-mex fix...but I am often let down.I would recommend going to the Soho location as I find the food and service are much better.

QYy2hAZnFD3gHppYpSBFOA.text: Chipotle in the UK is not like in the US. It's okay, but it doesn't live up to the American expectations

YrXeXgijyVhLnJmQsXcaPQ.text: It pains me to give Chiptole such a poor review, but like my father always says, "if the quesadilla disappoints, write a disparaging yelp review." Who knew dad was so prophetic? I knew Chiptole made quesadillas despite them not being on the menu so I was feeling like a major badass ordering from the secret menu. Well, next time I try to be cool I'll have a specific example to reference to dissuade me from even trying. The quesadilla was underdone, meaning the cheese was still in solid form, and the tortilla was soft and pale. I was busy so I didn't have the time to go up and get another one so I ate it, grimacing with every disappointing bite.And to add insult to injury, they charged me 70p for a side of sour cream which was genuinely filled with less than a tablespoon of insipid dairy liquid. Eat a d chipotle on baker street, eating a motherfucking d.

Kvttb0RpLL50Oofvys_3Zg.text: Its sad and great at the same time that this is the best Burrito place in London. Its solid. Can't complain and it scratches an itch that is really deeply engrained in my palate. Yummsville

H9ox3l_xv9S8K35ExDD85g.text: This is one of the worst Mexican chains in London. Dry meat overpriced and the tables were all quite dirty.

CaIJQyYg1cWF9E18A7IOQA.text: I've been living in London for three years, and it wasn't until last month I discovered this amazing place.For less than £10 you have burrito+drink; and it's so good and tasty. Basically, you join the queue (there's always a queue in Chipotle) and then you just pick up all you want: meat, veggies, cheese, salsa...there're a lot of ingredients to choose! I always go for the chicken but everything looks amazing. They also have tortilla chips and guacamole if you feel like having something else (their guacamole is one of the best I've ever tried)I'll come back for sure. It's cheap, it's quick and it's so Yummy!!

dyaZ8y1D3y4y22YKKAQqsw.text: Not sure about the reviews on here. My take is that the food quality is much higher than in the US, but this is outweighed by the higher price and small portions. + Better quality ingredients. Peppers are multicolored and the seasoning tastes better to me. + Chicken is a better cut. No tendons or inedible parts that you sometimes get in the US. - Price is more in £ than in $, meal ends up being close to double. - Portions are seriously laughable. You have to be uncomfortably aggressive with the employees to make sure you get a fair portion. I had to ask for extra cheese 3 times and I still only had half of what I would get in the US before I gave up. Overall, not bad for a quick fix of American "fast food" but leaves much to be desired.

o-1Qyu3mcGNPi3nWKqUz9w.text: A taste from the states! Very friendly staff. A quality burrito made with quality fresh ingredients and made to order. They were even willing to mix different meats in the same burrito! When I feel home sick I dream of chipotle!

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - London, United Kingdom. Steak burrito!

b2wZHESi3GcCtouL7MuJyw.text: Good food.  Quick service, and almost like what you find in the states.  Just a little bit off.    But still good quick food.

t3XcX9eEjk8tk_0BIUUaKg.text: Been here a few times now and absolutely love this place. So prior to the Yelp event held here I have never had a burrito. That all changed at this event. I found out that they made the guacamole fresh numerous times a day, we got to try some and I absolutely loved it. I've had the chicken burrito a few times here and have absolutely loved it. I have come here once specially for the burrito as its the closest Chipotle to me. The burrito was delicious and full flavoured. It was well made, full of flavour and they do not skimp on any of the ingredients at all. I know whenever I want a burrito fix, I will come here.

6fKRG-17ceUdCjcZg-0DRA.text: The food was okay, typical production line burrito fare (similar to Benito's Hat or Barburrito), although why guacamole is an extra £1.60 I have no idea. The reason it's only 2 stars is because two members of staff were disciplining another member of staff at the table next to us.. in the middle of the restaurant! It wasn't subtle at all, the manager seemed to be shouting the company handbook at the poor girl. Do they not have a staffroom? It was extremely unprofessional, it's a cheap meal but they wouldn't do something like that McDonalds.

NWvlQgd5R9afH4EHW9bKWg.text: This is the 2nd Chipotle shop in London. A decided (North) American take on Mexican (street) food.I've managed to visit the Baker Street Chipotle 3 to 4 times since it's official opening, and I've been been met with smiles, amazingly cheery attitudes and helpful staff. (Star #1)The Vegetarian/Vegan options are limited, but that's to be expected. The black beans are veg-friendly (the brown beans have bacon fat), and the guacamole is definitely of good quality, tasty and always a welcome addition to my burrito! (Star #2)After hearing my American accent, the Gen. Mgr. of the shop talked to me for a good while, asking me to share my thoughts on the food. I gave her my feedback, which genuinely appreciated! I was excited to receive a complimentary meal, for my next visit! (Stars #3 and #4!!)This is a American food chain, selling Mexican influenced fare. That's a given. The amazing aspect of the Baker Street shop of Chipotle has higher stands than those I encountered in the States, re: welcoming customers, accommodating diets (veg*n), and seeking input from people in the neighborhood.Well done Chipotle. Well done.
